description: Number of Hadamard matrices of order 4n.
comments: More precisely, number of inequivalent Hadamard matrices of order n if two matrices are considered equivalent if one can be obtained from the other by permuting rows, permuting columns and multiplying rows or columns by -1.The Hadamard conjecture is that a(n) > 0 for all n >= 0. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 08 2012
references: V. Alvarez, J. A. Armario, M. D. Frau and F. Gudlel, The maximal determinant of cocyclic (-1, 1)-matrices over D_{2t}, Linear Algebra and its Applications, 2011, in press; doi:10.1016/j.laa.2011.05.018
